#summary The SVG <a> element represents a hyperlink or placeholder similar to the HTML <a> element.
#labels about-svg
You are here: [Welcome Home] > [SVGElements SVG Elements] > *a element*

= Introduction =

The a element is used to create a hyperlink around SVG elements.  The a element uses attributes in the [XLink] [XMLNamespaces namespace] and thus, attributes like href and title must be prefixed with a namespace prefix that maps to "http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink".

HTML has an [AElement <a> element] which serves a similar purpose.

= Details =
== Usage ==

{{{
<a xlink:href="/" xlink:title="Go Home">
  <circle cx="50%" cy="50%" r="20%" fill="green"/>
</a>
<a xlink:href="example.com" target="_blank">
  <text x="50" y="50" font-size="20">Example</text>
</a>
}}}

== Attributes ==

Common attributes:

  * [XLinkHrefAttribute xlink:href]
  * [XLinkTitleAttribute xlink:title]
  * [ATargetAttribute target]

  * [http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/linking.html#Links The <a> element in SVG 1.1]
